text: Francis Edward Huish (9 December 1867 – 8 December 1955) was an English cricketer who played first-class cricket for Kent County Cricket Club during the 1895 English cricket season. He was born in Clapham in what was then Surrey in 1867 and died in Los Angeles, California in 1955.Francis Huish, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2016-08-30. Huish played as a bowler who appeared in five first-class matches. He made his first-class debut for Kent at Maidstone against Oxford University in June 1895 before going on to play in four County Championship matches for the county during July.First-class matches played by Francis Huish, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2016-08-30. His final first-class appearance was against Surrey at Catford. Huish played one non-first-class match for Surrey in the 1888 season before appearing for Surrey Second XI and Surrey Club and Ground between 1889 and 1891.Miscellaneous matches played by Francis Huish, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2016-08-30. He appeared twice for the Players of Kent in 1892 before playing in four matches for the Kent Second XI between 1894 and 1896. Huish's younger brother, Fred Huish, also made his first-class debut for Kent in June 1895First-class matches played by Fred Huish, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2016-08-30. before going on to make over 450 first-class appearances for the county, making his final appearance in 1914. He is regarded as "one of the ablest and least demonstrative wicket-keepers of his generation"Fred Huish - Obituary, Wisden Cricketers' Almanack, 1959. Retrieved 2016-08-30. and remains the record holder for most dismissals in a career for Kent.Most victims in a career for Kent, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2016-08-30. Huish emigrated to America in 1910 with his wife Ella. He became a naturalised US citizen in Pennsylvania in 1922.Francis Edward Huish in the Pennsylvania, Federal Naturalization Records, 1795-1931, Ancestry.com. Retrieved 2016-08-30.Francis Edward Huish, MyHeritage.
